summary: DOD uses live animals to train military personnel to treat battlefield injuries. DOD guidance states that alternatives will be considered and used whenever possible, if such methods produce scientifically or educationally valid or equivalent results. When animals are used, they are anesthetized to minimize pain or distress. DOD has made efforts to consider alternatives such as training videos, mannequins, and cadavers for trauma training. title: DOD Animal Use: Objectives and Performance Measures Needed to Monitor Use of Alternatives for Trauma Training
